update.description:
A script that loads the world on boot is passed when a server is loaded
- The server is also given a secret uuid token
- the server installs cloudsimi scripts upon boot
The server calls back to cloudsim.io when it is ready
- cloudsim.io updates the server state
update.title: Server callback when running

content.raw: I'm just waiting on the changes to cloudsimi
content.html: I'm just waiting on the changes to cloudsimi

content.raw: Looks good. I made notes in `cloudsimi`. Basically, remove ROS and use the latest version of Gazebo.
content.html: Looks good. I made notes in cloudsimi. Basically, remove ROS and use the latest version of Gazebo.

content.raw:
How to test:

You should have your AWS account details in the environment where you
run the grunt command:

```
#!bash

export AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID=xxxxx
export AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY=xxxxx
```

Then you can launch a simulator. 

You should see a "Launching simulator" message in the cloudsim.io log

```
#!bash

Launching simulator
- SSH key: cs-6-hugo@osrfoundation.org
- region:us-west-2
- hardware: g2.2xlarge
- image: ami-b8d2b088
- tags: { Name: 'simulator', user: 'hugo@osrfoundation.org', id: 6 }

```

30 sec later by an update:

```
#!bash

machine:{ id: 'i-e739f2ef', region: 'us-west-2' } status: { ip: '54.185.52.4', state: 'running' }

```

If you refresh the webpage, the simulator line should show a status of "Launching"

After the machine is ready, the cloudsim.io log should show a callback message:

```
#!bash

simulatorCallback data:{ world: 'Atlas',
  token: 'ed05d98c-6a7f-4c7f-953b-0b026937d1a8' }

```
You should now see the simulator state as "Running". You need to refresh the page, since the websocket support is not there yet.
content.html:
How to test:

You should have your AWS account details in the environment where you run the grunt command:

export AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID=xxxxx
export AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY=xxxxx

Then you can launch a simulator.

You should see a "Launching simulator" message in the cloudsim.io log

Launching simulator
- SSH key: cs-6-hugo@osrfoundation.org
- region:us-west-2
- hardware: g2.2xlarge
- image: ami-b8d2b088
- tags: { Name: 'simulator', user: 'hugo@osrfoundation.org', id: 6 }

30 sec later by an update:

machine:{ id: 'i-e739f2ef', region: 'us-west-2' } status: { ip: '54.185.52.4', state: 'running' }

If you refresh the webpage, the simulator line should show a status of "Launching"

After the machine is ready, the cloudsim.io log should show a callback message:

simulatorCallback data:{ world: 'Atlas',
  token: 'ed05d98c-6a7f-4c7f-953b-0b026937d1a8' }

You should now see the simulator state as "Running". You need to refresh the page, since the websocket support is not there yet.
